events.name: I/O Extended 2017 Aba
events.description: Google IO Extended Aba is an annual developers conference organized to learn about Google’s latest development and products in our community. Our target is to bring a maximum of 120 participants (developers and tech start-up owners) within our community to learn from the Google I/O sessions and local codelabs.

events.name: Ladies Code Android
events.description:
A tech meetup for Ladies in Aba, Abia State to learn Android App Development powered by GDG Aba and RAD5 Tech Hub.

This is bringing more ladies into the world of technology.

Registration link here: https://goo.gl/aEbMSj

events.name: GDG DevFest SE 2017 Aba
events.description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Link to Agenda: https://docs.google.com/document/d/164wvCrFKp5P4yc4Rtkdf2GsxpQlk--SF7Vn3TcGjlPQ/edit?usp=sharing

We are excited to announce that Google Developer Group (GDG) Aba will be hosting Developers Festival (DevFest 2017) for South South and South East Nigeria on November 10, 2017 at Eldorado Event Center Aba. DevFest 2016 held in Port Harcourt, Rivers State and was a huge success. 500 developers, entrepreneurs, organisations and government representatives were present at the event which took place at the The Autograph Port Harcourt, Rivers State. Nigeria. DevFest 2016 set the bar rather high, but we are definite we will host a bigger and more successful event this time around. For DevFest 2017, rockstar speakers and Googlers from Google Nigeria will speak and facilitate sessions on the following technologies: 

Google technologies and how we can leverage them to solve local problems 
Android App Development
Firebase 
Assistant
Google App Engine 
Progressive Web Apps 
Polymer 
Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence 
UI/UX 
Hands-on Codelabs on Android app development 
Robotics and Drone Technologies  

You may also visit https://devefestse.tech or our facebook page https://web.facebook.com/devfestse/ to register and keep up to date on developments. This will be the biggest developer conference (Convergence) in South South/ South East Nigeria for 2017. 

Happy DevFest 2017!!!

events.name: Making Progressive Web Apps
events.description:
Join the Progressive Web App (#PWA) meetup where you will learn to turn websites into progressive web apps just in few minutes. Mobile has natively come to the web.
Become a progressive web app developer and have your web apps run offline without internet, send push notifications, become installable like a purely native mobile app.

Time: 1PM - 4PM
Venue: RAD5 Tech Hub - 4th Floor, 7 Factory Road by Eziukwu Junction Aba Abia State
Date: February 08, 2018

Registration link: https://goo.gl/xJHw8q

Web is now progressive. Be progressive too

events.name: Exploring Git and GitHub
events.description:
• What we'll do
We will be learning on how to use Git and GitHub for Version control and collaboration. Understanding the use of GitHub.

• What to bring
Laptop, Power Extension, Notebook and pen

• Important to know
events.how_to_find_us: The floor storey building immediately before or after railway. We are at the 4th floor.

events.name: Study Jam - Mobile Site Certification
events.description:
Study Jams are community-run study groups for developers covering a range of Google Developers content.

Typically, Mobile Site Certification Study Jam is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate understanding in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development.
events.how_to_find_us: 4th Floor, 7 Factory Road By Eziukwu Junction Aba Abia State

events.name: Women Techmakers Aba IWD's 2018 Celebration
events.description:
• What we'll do
We're excited by the contributions women continue to make today. International Women's Day is an important moment to recognize how women have influenced the tech industry and beyond.

That is why we are mapping out a special day to celebrate women who are influencing the tech industry in our community.

A key component of that Women Techmakers International Women's Day Celebration is empowering women to pursue their dreams and build tools that change the world.

Having a diversity of perspectives and ideas leads to better decision-making, more relevant products, and makes the industry much more interesting. We believe that by creating the right environments, programs and policies, women in tech are better positioned to drive transformational change in the industry and beyond.

• What to bring
Notepad, Laptop, Pen

• Important to know

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Aba

venue.name: El-Dorado Event Center
venue.address_1: Plot 1 Diobu Avenue Aba North Junction, Aba-Owerri Road

events.description: Google I/O is the biggest developer event for tech lovers, googlers and google developers. The extended is an event for googlers and google developers from anywhere in the world to connect to the main event giving an opportunity for developers to be part of the global experience. The event is an avenue for developers to learn about new technologies and updates about Google tools and products that will help in building the next big app,supporting ideas and growing business. The extended event at GDG Aba will be an event for local developers to learn,network and showcase new ideas and product that they are working on.
events.how_to_find_us: Meet up at the hall by your right on entering the venue

events.name: Turn Content Into Actions Using Google Assistant
events.description:
• What we'll do
- Learn everything about the Google Assistant.
- Build apps for the Google Assistant.
- Turn your content into an Action.
- Build engaging apps with the latest features (Start global conversations, Sell goods and services, Build for families)

Google Assistant is getting smarter than Google Now ever was. Not only does the service support more than one language, but it also will soon feature more robust third-party integration, meaning that it can help you control your entire digital life — not just your Google life.

Do you want to build actions on Google for your community?
Be part of this meetup. Powered by GDG Aba.

• What to bring
Notebook, Pen, Laptop, A Friend

• Important to know
Register To Attend
events.how_to_find_us: The 4 story building close to the rail way along Aba-Owerri Road, Aba

events.name: Flutter Study Jam Aba
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/
events.how_to_find_us: We are at the fourth floor of the four Storey Building close to Railway and directly opposite UBA Bank

events.name: DevFest South East 2018
events.description:
GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Attendees will gain insight into latest Google tools and futuristic innovations by Google, network with tech experts in Africa during the event.

The GDG DevFest South-East conference is a cluster of 6 other GDGs around South-East Nigeria – Aba, Awka, Enugu, Njikoka, Oko and Umuahia.

events.name: WTM Aba Meetup - Building a Career in Tech.... Ladies Arising
events.description:
WTM meetup with the theme “Building a Career in Tech.... Ladies Arising” is a event designed to inspire, educate, and equip young females with the resources to acquire computing skills to pursue 21st century opportunities, thereby closing the gender employment difference in technology. It also aims at introducing new members of the community to leverage and embrace technology while exposing them to opportunities in technology.

Registration: https://bit.ly/2SGVPcu

events.name: Figma 1.0 Basic knowledge in UI/UX Designs for beginners
events.description: Figma 1.0 Meetup is an independently organized event for Nigerian Designers and Developers. The aim of this event is to shine more light into the intriguing and interesting world of design systems and how this can greatly influence the quality of products being put out there.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam 2019 Aba
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

events.name: Women Techmakers Aba IWD's 2019 Celebration

We're excited by the contributions women continue to make today. International Women's Day is an important moment to recognize how women have influenced the tech industry and beyond.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2019
events.description:
Google I/O Extended is focused on bringing the local developers community together to experience the keynote and other main Google I/O sessions.

This year's extended event at GDG Aba will be an event for local developers to learn,network and showcase new ideas and product that they are working on.
events.how_to_find_us: Four Storey Building beside Railway by Factory Road, right opposite the UBA Branch there.

upcoming.name: Flutter Study Jam 19
upcoming.description:
Flutter is Google’s portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?
Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine.

Check out : https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install
